meanings.definition: A person who takes a short sleep, especially during the day.
meanings.sent1: The tired napper dozed off on the couch.
meanings.sent2: The office napper always sneaks in a quick nap after lunch.
meanings.sent3: The dedicated napper even dreams about napping.
meanings.sent4: She was a champion napper, able to fall asleep anywhere.
meanings.sent5: The cozy blanket made the napper's nap even more peaceful.

meanings.definition: The top or crown of the head.
meanings.sent1: The hat sat perfectly on his napper.
meanings.sent2: She felt a gentle tap on her napper.
meanings.sent3: The bird landed on his napper, mistaking it for a tree.
meanings.sent4: The sun beat down on his napper, warming him up.
meanings.sent5: The crown rested elegantly on the queen's napper.

meanings.definition: A fabric with a raised nap, such as velvet.
meanings.sent1: The soft napper of the velvet fabric felt luxurious.
meanings.sent2: She admired the rich napper of the velvet drapes.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to knead the napper of the velvet cushion.
meanings.sent4: The napper of the velvet gown caught the light beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The napper of the velvet added a touch of elegance to the room.
